title: Weapon speed
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*See [Attack speed](/Attack_speed "Attack speed"), for an in-depth article on attack delay.*

This page lists the base and minimum delays of all melee and ranged weapons weapons and the skill level required to reach this minimum.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
  - [1.1 Modifiers](#Modifiers)

- [2 List of weapon delays](#List_of_weapon_delays)

  - [2.1 Short Blades](#Short_Blades)
  - [2.2 Long Blades](#Long_Blades)
  - [2.3 Maces and Flails](#Maces_and_Flails)
  - [2.4 Axes](#Axes)
  - [2.5 Polearms](#Polearms)
  - [2.6 Staves](#Staves)
  - [2.7 Ranged Weapons](#Ranged_Weapons)
  - [2.8 Throwing](#Throwing)

- [3 In-game display](#In-game_display)

- [4 See Also](#See_Also)

- [5 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Every weapon has a base delay. For every 2 levels in the corresponding weapon [skill](/Skill "Skill"), your attack delay is reduced by 1 [aut](/Aut "Aut") (ie. 0.1 [decaAut](/DecaAut "DecaAut")), until it reaches the minimum delay.

Most weapons have minimum attack delays of 5, 6, or 7 aut. The minimum delay is the smaller of (base delay / 2) and 7, with a few exceptions:

- [Rapiers](/Rapier "Rapier") and [quick blades](/Quick_blade "Quick blade"), which reach 5 to match other [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades").
- Crossbows ([hand crossbows](/Hand_crossbow "Hand crossbow"), [arbalests](/Arbalest "Arbalest"), [triple crossbows](/Triple_crossbow "Triple crossbow")), which have a mindelay of 10.
- [Stones](/Stone "Stone"), [darts](/Dart "Dart"), and [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang"), which are capped at 7.

[Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") works differently. For every 5.4 skill levels, unarmed attack delay is reduced by 1 aut. Therefore, Unarmed Combat starts at 10 delay and reaches 5 delay at skill 27.

### Modifiers

Some factors may further alter weapons' speed:

- [Speed](/Speed_\(brand\) "Speed (brand)")-branded weapons, which reduce the attack delay of a weapon by 33% at all skill levels.
- [Heavy](/Heavy "Heavy")-branded weapons, which increase attack delay by 50% at all skill levels.
- [Haste](/Haste "Haste") or [Berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") multiplies all delays by 66%.
- [Finesse](/Finesse "Finesse") halves all attack delays. Does not stack with haste/berserk.
- If you are wearing a shield you may suffer some penalties. See [Shields](/Shields#Shield_penalties "Shields").
- [Ranged weapons](/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon") are also encumbered by [body armour](/Body_armour "Body armour"). See [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons#Armour_penalty "Ranged Weapons").

Delays are rounded randomly in a weighted manner (if delay = 3.4, there is a 40% for 4 aut and 60% for 3 aut).

## List of weapon delays

### [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")

| Weapon                                      | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill Required |
| ------------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Dagger](/Dagger "Dagger")                  | 10         | 5         | 10             |
| [Short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword")   | 10         | 5         | 10             |
| [Rapier](/Rapier "Rapier")                  | 12         | 5         | 14             |
| [Quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade")\* | 12         | 5         | 14             |

\*Quick blades strike twice for every turn spent attacking.

### [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")

| Name                                            | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill Required |
| ----------------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Falchion](/Falchion "Falchion")                | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Long sword](/Long_sword "Long sword")          | 14         | 7         | 14             |
| [Scimitar](/Scimitar "Scimitar")                | 14         | 7         | 14             |
| [Demon blade](/Demon_blade "Demon blade")       | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Eudemon blade](/Eudemon_blade "Eudemon blade") | 12         | 6         | 12             |
| [Double sword](/Double_sword "Double sword")    | 15         | 7         | 16             |
| [Great sword](/Great_sword "Great sword")       | 17         | 7         | 20             |
| [Triple sword](/Triple_sword "Triple sword")    | 19         | 7         | 24             |

### [Maces and Flails](/Maces_and_Flails "Maces and Flails")

| Name                                                        | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill required |
| ----------------------------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Club](/Club "Club")                                        | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Whip](/Whip "Whip")                                        | 11         | 5         | 12             |
| [Mace](/Mace "Mace")                                        | 14         | 7         | 14             |
| [Flail](/Flail "Flail")                                     | 14         | 7         | 14             |
| [Morningstar](/Morningstar "Morningstar")                   | 15         | 7         | 16             |
| [Demon whip](/Demon_whip "Demon whip")                      | 11         | 5         | 12             |
| [Sacred scourge](/Sacred_scourge "Sacred scourge")          | 11         | 5         | 12             |
| [Dire flail](/Dire_flail "Dire flail")                      | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Eveningstar](/Eveningstar "Eveningstar")                   | 15         | 7         | 16             |
| [Great mace](/Great_mace "Great mace")                      | 17         | 7         | 20             |
| [Giant club](/Giant_club "Giant club")                      | 16         | 7         | 18             |
| [Giant spiked club](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club") | 18         | 7         | 22             |

### [Axes](/Axes "Axes")

| Name                                                          | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill Required |
| ------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe")                              | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [War axe](/War_axe "War axe")                                 | 15         | 7         | 16             |
| [Broad axe](/Broad_axe "Broad axe")                           | 16         | 7         | 18             |
| [Battleaxe](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe")                           | 17         | 7         | 20             |
| [Executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") | 19         | 7         | 24             |

### [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")

| Name                                            | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill Required |
| ----------------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Spear](/Spear "Spear")                         | 11         | 5         | 12             |
| [Trident](/Trident "Trident")                   | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Demon trident](/Demon_trident "Demon trident") | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Trishula](/Trishula "Trishula")                | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Halberd](/Halberd "Halberd")                   | 15         | 7         | 16             |
| [Glaive](/Glaive "Glaive")                      | 17         | 7         | 20             |
| [Bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche")                | 19         | 7         | 24             |

### [Staves](/Staves "Staves")

| Name                                            | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill Required |
| ----------------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Magical staff](/Magical_staff "Magical staff") | 12         | 6         | 12             |
| [Quarterstaff](/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")    | 13         | 6         | 14             |
| [Lajatang](/Lajatang "Lajatang")                | 14         | 7         | 14             |

### [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")

| Name                                                  | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill Required |
| ----------------------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Sling](/Sling "Sling")                               | 14         | 7         | 14             |
| [Shortbow](/Shortbow "Shortbow")                      | 14         | 7         | 14             |
| [Orcbow](/Orcbow "Orcbow")                            | 15         | 7         | 16             |
| [Arbalest](/Arbalest "Arbalest")                      | 19         | 10        | 18             |
| [Hand cannon](/Hand_cannon "Hand cannon")             | 19         | 10        | 18             |
| [Longbow](/Longbow "Longbow")                         | 17         | 7         | 20             |
| [Triple crossbow](/Triple_crossbow "Triple crossbow") | 23         | 10        | 26             |

### [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")

| Name                                   | Base Delay | Min Delay | Skill Required |
| -------------------------------------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- |
| [Dart](/Dart "Dart")                   | 10         | 7         | 6              |
| [Stone](/Stone "Stone")                | 11         | 7         | 8              |
| [Boomerang](/Boomerang "Boomerang")    | 13         | 7         | 12             |
| [Javelin](/Javelin "Javelin")          | 15         | 7         | 16             |
| [Large rock](/Large_rock "Large rock") | 20         | 7         | 26             |

## In-game display

There are three different ways to obtain some information about your attack speed.

- Viewing the weapon in the **i**nventory will display its current average delay.
- The **@** command will print your average attack delay.
- The turn counter in the stat area will display the time your last action took in parentheses next to the total time the game has taken. Using ctrl+direction to swing at nothing a few times should give you a pretty good indication of your attack delay.

The former two commands display the *average* attack speed, to the nearest aut. If your attack delay is not an integer, it'll semi-randomly round up and down.

## See Also

- [Melee weapon](/Melee_weapon "Melee weapon")
- [Attack speed](/Attack_speed "Attack speed")

See individual weapon articles for more information about a given weapon.

## History

- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), [unarmed combat](/Unarmed_combat "Unarmed combat") was penalized by armour.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), [ranged weapons](/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon") used a completely different delay formula: `Base delay - Weapon Skill*4*Average Stat/250`.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), the [speed](/Speed_\(brand\) "Speed (brand)") brand halved your attack delay rounding up, and decreased pre-AC damage by 10%.
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), Finesse had no effect on non-[blowgun](/Blowgun "Blowgun") throwing weapons.
html:
Weapon speed

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

See Attack speed, for an in-depth article on attack delay.

This page lists the base and minimum delays of all melee and ranged weapons weapons and the skill level required to reach this minimum.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
    • 1.1 Modifiers
  • 2 List of weapon delays
    • 2.1 Short Blades
    • 2.2 Long Blades
    • 2.3 Maces and Flails
    • 2.4 Axes
    • 2.5 Polearms
    • 2.6 Staves
    • 2.7 Ranged Weapons
    • 2.8 Throwing
  • 3 In-game display
  • 4 See Also
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Every weapon has a base delay. For every 2 levels in the corresponding weapon skill, your attack delay is reduced by 1 aut (ie. 0.1 decaAut), until it reaches the minimum delay.

Most weapons have minimum attack delays of 5, 6, or 7 aut. The minimum delay is the smaller of (base delay / 2) and 7, with a few exceptions:

  • Rapiers and quick blades, which reach 5 to match other Short Blades.
  • Crossbows (hand crossbows, arbalests, triple crossbows), which have a mindelay of 10.
  • Stones, darts, and boomerangs, which are capped at 7.

Unarmed Combat works differently. For every 5.4 skill levels, unarmed attack delay is reduced by 1 aut. Therefore, Unarmed Combat starts at 10 delay and reaches 5 delay at skill 27.

Modifiers

Some factors may further alter weapons' speed:

  • Speed-branded weapons, which reduce the attack delay of a weapon by 33% at all skill levels.
  • Heavy-branded weapons, which increase attack delay by 50% at all skill levels.
  • Haste or Berserk multiplies all delays by 66%.
  • Finesse halves all attack delays. Does not stack with haste/berserk.
  • If you are wearing a shield you may suffer some penalties. See Shields.
  • Ranged weapons are also encumbered by body armour. See Ranged Weapons.

Delays are rounded randomly in a weighted manner (if delay = 3.4, there is a 40% for 4 aut and 60% for 3 aut).

List of weapon delays

Short Blades

Weapon Base Delay Min Delay Skill Required
Dagger 10 5 10
Short sword 10 5 10
Rapier 12 5 14
Quick blade* 12 5 14

*Quick blades strike twice for every turn spent attacking.

Long Blades

Name Base Delay Min Delay Skill Required
Falchion 13 6 14
Long sword 14 7 14
Scimitar 14 7 14
Demon blade 13 6 14
Eudemon blade 12 6 12
Double sword 15 7 16
Great sword 17 7 20
Triple sword 19 7 24

Maces and Flails

Name Base Delay Min Delay Skill required
Club 13 6 14
Whip 11 5 12
Mace 14 7 14
Flail 14 7 14
Morningstar 15 7 16
Demon whip 11 5 12
Sacred scourge 11 5 12
Dire flail 13 6 14
Eveningstar 15 7 16
Great mace 17 7 20
Giant club 16 7 18
Giant spiked club 18 7 22

Axes

Name Base Delay Min Delay Skill Required
Hand axe 13 6 14
War axe 15 7 16
Broad axe 16 7 18
Battleaxe 17 7 20
Executioner's axe 19 7 24

Polearms

Name Base Delay Min Delay Skill Required
Spear 11 5 12
Trident 13 6 14
Demon trident 13 6 14
Trishula 13 6 14
Halberd 15 7 16
Glaive 17 7 20
Bardiche 19 7 24

Staves

Name Base Delay Min Delay Skill Required
Magical staff 12 6 12
Quarterstaff 13 6 14
Lajatang 14 7 14

Ranged Weapons

Name Base Delay Min Delay Skill Required
Sling 14 7 14
Shortbow 14 7 14
Orcbow 15 7 16
Arbalest 19 10 18
Hand cannon 19 10 18
Longbow 17 7 20
Triple crossbow 23 10 26

Throwing

Name Base Delay Min Delay Skill Required
Dart 10 7 6
Stone 11 7 8
Boomerang 13 7 12
Javelin 15 7 16
Large rock 20 7 26

In-game display

There are three different ways to obtain some information about your attack speed.

  • Viewing the weapon in the inventory will display its current average delay.
  • The @ command will print your average attack delay.
  • The turn counter in the stat area will display the time your last action took in parentheses next to the total time the game has taken. Using ctrl+direction to swing at nothing a few times should give you a pretty good indication of your attack delay.

The former two commands display the average attack speed, to the nearest aut. If your attack delay is not an integer, it'll semi-randomly round up and down.

See Also

  • Melee weapon
  • Attack speed

See individual weapon articles for more information about a given weapon.

History

  • Prior to 0.17, unarmed combat was penalized by armour.
  • Prior to 0.15, ranged weapons used a completely different delay formula: Base delay - Weapon Skill*4*Average Stat/250.
  • Prior to 0.14, the speed brand halved your attack delay rounding up, and decreased pre-AC damage by 10%.
  • Prior to 0.13, Finesse had no effect on non-blowgun throwing weapons.

Most weapons have minimum attack delays of 5, 6, or 7 aut.
